DataElement.preferredName: Radiation Therapy Other Immobilization Technique Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text that describes another kind of immobilization technique used during radiation therapy not already specified.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation._Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned._The application of a restraint to restrict normal movement of an individual's body, limb, or joint._A practiced and regimented skill or series of actions.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: use PHOTOTHERAPY, LASER THERAPY, or ULTRAVIOLET THERAPY for therapeutic radiation with visible, laser, or ultraviolet light, respectively.

Concepts.definition: Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation.

Property.preferredDefinition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.:The application of a restraint to restrict normal movement of an individual's body, limb, or joint.:A practiced and regimented skill or series of actions.

The application of a restraint to restrict normal movement of an individual's body, limb, or joint.
A practiced and regimented skill or series of actions.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

DataElementConcept.origin: Princess Margaret Cancer Centre, Toronto, ON

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The free text field that describes another response when other is chosen from a list of values.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.
